moves.1. e4 e5 2. Bc4 Nf6 3. d3 d6 4. h3: White's play is defensive, and gives Black goos prospects of siezing the initiative.
moves.6. exd5 cxd5 7. Bb3 Nc6 8. c3 d4: This advance gives Black more space.
moves.9. Bg5 Be7 10. Nf3 Nd5: Black is willing to exchange his semi bad bishop.
moves.11. Bd2 Bf5 12. Qe2 Qd6 13. Na3: ?? With a strong threat, but fails tactically...
moves.16... O-O: ! Indirectly protecting the bishop and the advantage in development
moves.17. Nxc6 bxc6 18. O-O Bf6 19. d4: Black has a won game but needs to be careful of swindles on his kingside.
moves.19... Rae8 20. Qd2 Qa6 21. Qf4 Be6 22. B: Forced, but Black wants a retreat square for the artificially fianchettoed DSB.
moves.24. Qf3 Bg7 25. h4 Bd5 26. Qg3 Bxd4: ! Black has set up this combo.
moves.27. cxd4 Qxc2 28. h5 Kg7: Black decides to prevent further advance and prepare a counterattacking pawn storn supported by the strong bishop.
Black has developed a strong attack.
moves.35. f3 Qf4: !? Black uses the threat of a Q exchange to advance.
moves.36. Qf2: ?! The Q exchange offered more resistance.
moves.37. Rxa7 g3: ! White's king is now boxed in...
